How to Install kdesignerplugin on debian

  • Home
  • debian
  • kdesignerplugin

Today in this tutorial, I’ll show you how you can install kdesignerplugin on debian with and without using the command line.

Introduction

Installing kdesignerplugin on debian is very easy. And with the help of this tutorial, you will be able to easily install, update and uninstall kdesignerplugin in just a few steps.

In this tutorial I’ll show you four methods to install kdesignerplugin, the methods are using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic. All these methods require you to have an active and stable internet connection and sudo permission.

Install kdesignerplugin Using apt

To install kdesignerplugin in debian using apt, you will need to run the apt update command first to get the updated list of packages from the repositories.

Copy the command given below and paste it in the command line, then press enter. If you are using the sudo command for the first time then you might also need to enter your root password.

sudo apt update

After you have updated the package list using apt, you can now install kdesignerplugin using the apt install command. To do that use the command given below.

sudo apt -y install kdesignerplugin

The installation of kdesignerplugin might take a little bit of time depending upon your internet connection and machine configuration.

Install kdesignerplugin Using apt-get

To install kdesignerplugin using apt-get in debian, you will need to first update the package list using the apt-get update command. Copy, paste, and enter the command given below in the command line.

sudo apt-get update

After updating the package lists, use the apt-get install command given below to install kdesignerplugin.

sudo apt-get -y install kdesignerplugin

Install kdesignerplugin Using Synaptic

To install kdesignerplugin using Synaptic you will need to first install Synaptic, you can do that by following the instructions from here. After installing synaptic follow the steps below to install kdesignerplugin on your debian using Synaptic.

You can open synaptic by clicking on the menu icon then searching for synaptic or you can open the command line and enter the command given below –

sudo synaptic

After synaptic opens, click on the search icon and search for kdesignerplugin. This will display the kdesignerplugin package in the package window, now to install kdesignerplugin, click on the checkbox that is on the left side.

Then click on Mark for Installation, this will select the kdesignerplugin package for installation, now to install it click on the Apply button, you will get a summary window where click on the apply button again to start the download of kdesignerplugin.

If the download and installation are successful then the checkmark option will turn green.

Install kdesignerplugin Using aptitude

To install kdesignerplugin on debian using aptitude, you will need to first install Aptitude in your debian. To install Aptitude follow the instructions here. Once you have aptitude installed proceed to the installation of kdesignerplugin.

Now you will need to first update your package lists from the repositories, use the apt update command for that, after that update the package list of aptitude using the aptitude update command.

sudo apt update sudo aptitude update

After updating the package list of aptitude, install kdesignerplugin using the command aptitude install kdesignerplugin.

sudo aptitude -y install kdesignerplugin

How to Upgrade kdesignerplugin on debian

If you want to upgrade the kdesignerplugin package on your debian to its latest version then here’s how you can do that using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic.

Upgrade kdesignerplugin using Apt & Apt-get

To upgrade kdesignerplugin to its latest version using apt or apt-get, you will need to open the terminal then run the sudo apt update command to update the package list, after that copy and paste the commands given below to upgrade kdesignerplugin.

sudo apt install --only-upgrade kdesignerplugin sudo apt-get install --only-upgrade kdesignerplugin

Upgrade kdesignerplugin using Aptitude

To upgrade kdesignerplugin using aptitude you will need to again run the update command to update the package list, use command sudo aptitude update to do that. After that run the command given below to upgrade kdesignerplugin.

sudo aptitude -y full-upgrade kdesignerplugin

Upgrade kdesignerplugin using Synaptic

To upgrade kdesignerplugin using synaptic open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or by going to the menu and searching for synaptic.

In synaptic click on the reload button, this will look for updates. After that you will need to search for kdesignerplugin, now right-click kdesignerplugin, and click on the mark for upgrade option.

Now to upgrade kdesignerplugin just click on the apply button, then click on the apply button again in the summary screen.

How To Uninstall kdesignerplugin on debian

If you want to remove and uninstall kdesignerplugin from your debian then here’s how you can do that. To remove just kdesignerplugin, you can use the command that is given below, copy the command, paste it in the command line then press enter.

sudo apt remove kdesignerplugin

Remove related packages, dependencies & configuration files of kdesignerplugin

To remove all the related packages, dependencies and configuration files of kdesignerplugin you can use the command given below.

sudo apt -y purge kdesignerplugin

Remove kdesignerplugin using Synaptic Package Manager

You can also uninstall kdesignerplugin using the synaptic package manager, first open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or search and open it directly.

After that in synaptic search for kdesignerplugin, right-click the kdesignerplugin package and click on the Mark for Complete Removal option. Now to uninstall kdesignerplugin click on the apply button then in summary click on apply again.

Conclusion

That is how you can install kdesignerplugin on debian using the command line or using the synaptic package manager. I also showed you how you can uninstall and upgrade kdesignerplugin using the command line or using the synaptic package manager.

If you need any help regarding the installation of kdesignerplugin then send me a mail at netmikoblog@gmail.com, thank you.
